proof:
Proof. By Lemmas 33, and 34, whp all vertex sets in G with size at least $\ge \eta n$ have average degree is at least $3d/4$. Also by the second part of the first Lemma, whp, for any vertex set $S \subseteq V_G$ with size between $\eta n$ and $(1-\eta)n$, $|E_G(S,S)| \ge \frac{5d}{6}|S|(n-|S|)$. Also whp $n_C \ge (1-e^{-d/3})n$. Assume further on G satisfies these properties.
Also by the choice of $\eta$ and by Lemma 12, whp G is such that for any $F \in \Omega_C^{\text{ord}}$, there is a giant component in $(V_C, F)$ with total degree $\ge \frac{9}{10}\text{degg}(V_C)$. Thus the set $S$ of vertices in the non-giant components has total degree $\le \frac{1}{10}\text{degg}(V_C)$. Note that all edges in $E_G(S,S)$ are in $E_C \setminus F$. We consider three cases, based on the size of S.
Next consider the case $\eta n \le |S| \le \frac{n}{2}$. Then $|E_C \setminus F| \ge |E_G(S,S)| \ge \frac{5\eta nd}{12}$. But whp $|E_C| \le \frac{dn}{2}+o(n) < \frac{3dn}{4}$, so this contradicts $|E_C \setminus F| \le \eta|E_C|$.
If $|S| \ge \frac{n}{2}$, then $\text{degg}(S) > \frac{dn}{4}$. But also $\text{degg}(S) \le \frac{\text{degg}(V_C)}{10} < \frac{dn}{10}+o(n)$, which is a contradiction.
Thus the only remaining possibility is $|S| \le \eta n$. Then $c(F) \le |S| \le \eta n + 1$ and $|F| < |E_C| \le nd/2+\eta n$ (the last inequality holds whp). Thus we obtain that $w_C(F) < q^{\eta n+1}(e^\beta - 1)^{nd/2+\eta n} < q^{\eta n+2-1/10 \cdot nd/d+\eta n} = q^{n[1-1/20+2\eta]}$.
Since $\emptyset$ is a configuration with a weight $q^{n_C} > q^{n(1-e^{-d/3})}$, it follows that $Z_C > q^{n-ne^{-d/3}}$. There are at most $2^{|E_C|} = 2^{nd/2+\eta n}$ ordered configurations, therefore,
$$ \frac{Z_C^{\text{dis}}}{Z_C} < 2^{nd/2+\eta n}q^{n[\eta-1+1-1/10+2\eta+e^{-d/3}]} = \exp\{n[d\ln 2/2 + \log q(-1/10+2\eta+e^{-d/3})]\}. $$
Since $1/10 - 2\eta - e^{-d/3} > 1/20$ for all d large enough, this becomes $\exp\{nd \ln 2/2 - n \log q/20\}$, which is $\le e^{-n}$ for all q large enough.
